title: Harry and Meghan documentary viewers gush over 'sweet' couple who 'finish each other's sentences'
text:

Viewers of Harry and Meghan: An African Journey were unable to resist gushing over the happily married royal couple as their documentary aired on ITV on Sunday night.

Prince Harry ,35, and 38-year-old Meghan Markle's behind-the-scenes film followed the couple and their son Archie during their 10-day Royal Tour of Africa.

As scenes showed off-guard and tender moments shared between the newlyweds and their son TV watchers admired the pairs "sweet" and "cute" relationship as well as voicing their admiration for the husband and wife.

One fan typed: "Meghan and Harry are so sweet… #HarryandMeghan."

Another gushed: "Harry and Meghan are like twins. One starts one sentence and the other ends it."

"This documentary is giving me all the feels. Harry’s amazing and Meghan’s just so lovely, warm and kind," typed a viewer. And Archie is so cute and smiley! What a beautiful family #HarryAndMeghan."

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Another marvelled: "Never a royalist but it’s hard to dislike #harryandmeghan."

"Nothing but respect for these two. #HarryAndMeghan alongside a moving clip of them" and "I absolutely adore Harry and Meghan!" wrote others.

Others added: "Watching the Meghan and Harry documentary How can you not love them as a couple?!"

"I like these two. I really wish them well. #HarryandMeghan ," and "That was cute they're very passionate about their causes #HarryandMeghan."

(Image: ITV)

Meghan and Archie stayed in South Africa for the entire 10-day trip, the family's first as a three, while Harry headed off to Botswana, Angola and Malawi.

The Duke is very fond of the continent, often referring to it as his "second home", and he spoke passionately about it during his time there.

(Image: Getty Images)

On the final day of the trip Harry said: "Ever since I came to this continent as a young boy, trying to cope with something I can never possibly describe, Africa has held me in an embrace that I will never forget, and I feel incredibly fortunate for that.

And every time I come here; I know that I’m not alone.

"I always feel - wherever I am on this continent - that the community around me provides a life that is enriching, and is rooted in the simplest things - connection, connections with others and the natural environment."
description: TV viewers have taken to social media to share how they admire the royal couple as their documentary airs on ITV
